thread.section_title: Jose Mourinho explains defensive Manchester United changes during Middlesbrough win – Metro
thread.title: Jose Mourinho explains defensive Manchester United changes during Middlesbrough win
thread.title_full: Jose Mourinho explains defensive Manchester United changes during Middlesbrough win

author: George Bellshaw
title: Jose Mourinho explains defensive Manchester United changes during Middlesbrough win
text:
Mourinho reverted to a defensive outlook (Picture: Getty) Jose Mourinho has revealed that he chucked on extra defenders against Middlesbrough to help deal with the aerial pressure being put on them by Rudy Gestede and Alvaro Negredo.
The Red Devils ended the match with six defensive players in the pitch as they looked to cling on to a one-goal lead against Steve Agnew’s side.
Manchester United make Premier League history with win over Middlesbrough Marcos Rojo replaced Juan Mata before Middlesbrough pulled one back and joined other defensive players Eric Bailly, Chris Smalling, Phil Jones, Ashley Young (who was deployed at left wing-back) and Antonio Valncia in forming a defensive wall as United looked to hang on before Valencia latched onto a Victor Valdes mistake to secure all three points.
Gestede provided a threat (Picture: Getty) And Mourinho explained that he made the defensive move as a reply to Steve Agnew bringing on Gestede with just more than 20 minutes to go.
‘They changed the play with Gestede and Negredo,’ he said after the 3-1 win.
‘They played long balls so we decided to defend with an extra defender.
‘We made the mistake of letting them push us into the box. It was a fighting 15 minutes.
More: Football Man Utd fans rejoice as they move above 6th for first time since December 
Middlesbrough 1-3 Manchester United player ratings: Lingard the star 
Manchester United put Arsenal in position they’ve not been for over a decade 
‘They didn’t have chances but they were close to dangerous areas.’
Goals from Marouane Fellaini, Jesse Lingard and Valencia saw United earn all three points, with Gestede getting Middlesbrough’s only goal.
